qas.question: What are attacks designed to make a machine or network unavailable to its intended users?
What does deliberately entering the wrong password enough consecutive times cause?

answers.text: the victim account to be locked

qas.question: What are attacks where innocent systems are fooled into sending traffic to the victom called?
How can a network attack from a single IP address be blocked?

answers.text: by adding a new firewall rule

plausible_answers.text: cause the victim account to be locked

qas.question: What happens if an attacker enters the wrong password into an account enough times?
What is the point of making network resources unavailable to users?

plausible_answers.text: the attack comes from a large number of points

qas.question: Why is it difficult to defend against DDos?

plausible_answers.text: they may overload the capabilities of a machine or network and block all users at once

qas.question: Other than being locked out what other methods are used in DDos?

plausible_answers.text: from the zombie computers of a botnet

qas.question: What allows a machine to be accessed by its user?

plausible_answers.text: deliberately entering a wrong password enough consecutive times

qas.question: What is done to a password to lock out all users at once?
How is a DDoS from multiple locations defended?
What are zombie computers on a botnet?
